name: Current and Unsolved: Crimes and Disappearances Trivia Game  | 10 Questions

questions.text: The hot story of 2001 was the disappearance of Chandra Levy. Her name is linked with Gary Condit. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
House Democrat.

	What was the relationship? An affair? Why did she disappear? Who was involved - and what was the motive? Questions only - no answers.

California.

	Not the whole state - just one part of it. It will be interesting if he campaigns for re-election.

questions.text: The principal suspect in the Martha Moxley murder is connected to what prominent family?
questions.explanation:
Kennedy.

	The Skakels are related to Ethel Kennedy. Someone beat Martha to death when she was about 15 years old.

questions.text: Martha Moxley lived in what affluent community?
questions.explanation:
Greenwich.

	Connecticut. Even in the best of towns ...

questions.text: JonBenet Ramsey's death is still unsolved. Where was her body found?
Who wrote 'Perfect Murder, Perfect Town' about the Ramsay case?
questions.explanation:
Lawrence Schiller.

	All of the others have written about current crimes. The 'perfect town' is Boulder, Colorado.

questions.text: A less familiar disappearance involves Jodi Huisentruit. From what state did she disappear?
questions.explanation:
Iowa.

	Even in small town America ...

questions.text: Why was Jodi Huisentruit well-known in the community?
questions.explanation:
TV Newsperson.

	She apparently disappeared while on her way to her on-the-air news job early in the A.M.. Several years have passed; foul play seems likely.

questions.text: Which of these four cases involved a ransom note?
questions.explanation:
JonBenet R.

	Such a note was found in the Ramsey case only.

questions.text: Which of the preceding four cases involves issues having to do with the proper classification of an individual as a juvenile or as an adult?
questions.explanation:
Martha M.

	Since so much time has passed since the crime was committed, the perpetrator - who may have been a juvenile at the time - is now an adult. It raises some unusual legal issues.
